permission.name: Authorization Policy
permission.policyTip: The "Permission Policy" enables granular access control over application menus, buttons, panel functions, and API resources. After assigning policies to users, departments, or groups, users (including those in authorized departments/groups) will gain corresponding functional and API permissions. Note: "System Administrators" have full permissions for all applications, while "Application Administrators" have full permissions for their respective applications.
permission.defaultPolicyTip: By default, if users don't modify settings, the system assigns "Standard User" or "Guest" as the default access level. New users automatically inherit this upon joining. To modify default access, edit the application's default policy below. To disable default access and require manual authorization, select "Deny Access".

assocPolicies.name: Policy Name
assocPolicies.authTip: To revoke "Application Default Authorization", disable the policy under "Permission Policy" > "Default Policies". For department/group-associated policies, revoke via "Organization" > "Departments" or "Groups" > "Permission Policies". Note: "Initial Authorization" cannot be revoked.

policy.tip: Permission policies define user/department/group access rights to applications, including functional and menu permissions, supporting both on-demand and batch authorization.

add.title: Permission Policy
add.defaultPolicyTip: When enabled, this policy becomes available as a "Default Permission Policy" option.

default.title: Application Default Permission Policy
default.tip: Configure default permission policies for applications; new users automatically inherit these permissions
default.disableTip: Disabling the current "Application Default Authorization" will invalidate all "{policyName}" policy permissions system-wide. New users will be denied application access. Confirm to proceed?
default.authTip: Updating will grant "{policyName}" policy to all users. Confirm to proceed?

detail.defaultPolicyHint: This policy is currently set as the initial "Default Permission Policy" for users. No additional authorization needed. To revoke: You must disable both the "Application Default Authorization" setting AND any duplicate explicit authorizations. Disabling only the default setting won't remove existing duplicate authorizations.
